bug.author: hysunflower
bug.summary: mxnet =1.6.0, gluoncv=0.6.0 ,,,AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'context'
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
I pulled mxnet/python:nightly_gpu_cu101_py2 images from dockerhub, and installed gluoncv=0.6.0 mxnet =1.6.0 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52739577/76922737-90516980-690c-11ea-95eb-ad507c723c8b.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52739577/76922751-98110e00-690c-11ea-8668-dfd1472c7b2d.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52739577/76922755-9c3d2b80-690c-11ea-878b-fba50c6bf4e3.png></denchmark-link>
Then I tried to test a yolov3 models <denchmark-h:h3>Error Message</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52739577/76922921-fe962c00-690c-11ea-8a9c-14107cf169d8.png></denchmark-link>
I want to know how to address it , thank you <denchmark-code></denchmark-code>

comments.comment: I have worked out this problem. this problem is reasoned by the space of docker, I tried to give the docker 100G space, then solved. em,anyway, I think this error message should be opitimized
